title: About the comics

replies.body:
The confusion is the difference between this year (2019) and next year (2020).   (and that we use 6months in several different ways)

 This year:  All comics are released digitally for free on League of Legend's Universe page. They are also simultaneously sold as a premier edition with bonus content - released on Comixology's and Marvel's readers.  (The premier edition also takes advantage on Marvel and Comixology panel zoom functions, page structure, collection structure, etc...).   
 
Then 6 months after the digital comics are released marvel will release a physical collection, combining all of the previous issues into one book that will be for sale at local shops, amazon, etc.  (Aka a Trade Paperback.)


BUT...

Starting in 2020:  
The books are sold as physical, floppy comic-books in stores, on Marvel reader, and on Comixology.    
Then 6 months later, only when we are selling the Trade Paperbacks will the comics go up for free on League of Legend's Universe's website.

Make sense now?
